english: Doctrine of the Mean; middle way

etymology.description: 中(middle) + 庸(mean/moderation) + 之(of) + 道(way) = “the way of the mean.”
etymology.interpretation: Confucian principle of appropriate moderation—finding the fitting degree between excess and deficiency in action and judgment. Emphasizes context-sensitive balance, not bland compromise.

examples.chinese: 我们应遵循中庸之道(我們應遵循中庸之道)，避免走极端(避免走極端)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yīng zūnxún zhōngyōng zhī dào, bìmiǎn zǒu jíduān.
examples.english: We should follow the Doctrine of the Mean and avoid extremes.

examples.chinese: 在处理冲突时(在處理衝突時)，中庸之道强调把握分寸与时机(中庸之道強調把握分寸與時機)。
examples.pinyin: Zài chǔlǐ chōngtū shí, zhōngyōng zhī dào qiángdiào bǎwò fēncùn yǔ shíjī.
examples.english: When handling conflicts, the middle way stresses grasping the right measure and timing.

examples.chinese: 中庸之道不是折中妥协(中庸之道不是折中妥協)，而是合乎礼与义的适度选择(而是合乎禮與義的適度選擇)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngyōng zhī dào bù shì zhézhōng tuǒxié, ér shì héhū lǐ yǔ yì de shìdù xuǎnzé.
examples.english: The doctrine is not a mere compromise but a measured choice aligned with propriety and righteousness.
